intro: Agathaea stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf agathos, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly serrated margin, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Agathosia stricta is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodlands and meadows.
